text: (upbeat music)

- GE Digital is a subsidiary
of General Electric.
GE Digital has a lot of software products

and services in several
different verticals,
aviation, energy and manufacturing.

We grew from handful of
sites couple of years ago

to a hundred plus sites
today, and still growing.
It added more operational cost,
as well as time from our teams.
So that meant that it took away time

from our engineering effort to
improve the product roadmap.
The AWS ecosystem offers

many different features
that we can leverage.
And then look to increase
the feature roadmap of our product.

So an advantage of Redshift
being fully managed,
it facilitated a great deal to us.
We are noticing a 74% improvement
in overall transformations.
And our data latency from source
to data models is improved by 87%.

We can also use the
auto workload management

and concurrency scaling, it
does the scaling in the back.
Whenever there is spike in the load
with regards to transformations,

whenever there is a spike in
the load with regards to API,
Redshift does it automatically.
That means that we can really
add more features to our product,

which we are asked by our
customers time and again.

And now we're able to do
it with Amazon Redshift.
(upbeat music)
